Class InvokeSubProcessActivity

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GeneralActivity, InvokeProcessActivity, SuspendibleActivity

    @Tracked(value=TRACE)
public class InvokeSubProcessActivity
extends InvokeProcessActivityBase
    This activity implementor implements invocation of subprocesses.

    • Method Detail

      • needSuspend

        public boolean needSuspend()
        Description copied from interface: SuspendibleActivity
        The method is invoked by the engine right after the activity is executed, to determine whether to put the activity instance in waiting status. Not all suspendible activities need to be suspended. For example, asynchronous process invocation, event wait when the event is already arrived, etc.
        Specified by:
        needSuspend in interface SuspendibleActivity
        Overrides:
        needSuspend in class AbstractWait
        Returns:
        true if the activity instance really needs to be suspended (put in WAITING status).

      • createVariableBinding

        protected Map<String,String> createVariableBinding(List<Variable> childVars)
                                            throws Exception
        This method returns variable bindings to be passed into subprocess. The method uses the attribute "variables" values as a mapping. The binding of each variable is an expression in the Java Expression Language (beginning with '#'), or the Magic Box rule language (beginning with '$'). Example bindings: #{myVar}_suffix, "var1=12*12;var2=$parent_var.LIST.LN" Subclass may override this method to obtain variable binding in other ways.
        Parameters:
        childVars - variables defined for the child process
        prMgr - process manager remote EJB handle
        varMgr - variable manager remote EJB handle
        Returns:
        a map (name-value pairs) of variable bindings
        Throws:
        Exception - various types of exceptions

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws ActivityException
        Description copied from class: DefaultActivityImpl
        This method will be deprecated soon. The preferred method to override is the execute() that takes an ActivityRuntimeContext and returns Object.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface GeneralActivity
